title: Buy your first home or save into a pension: which leaves you £15,000 better off?
text:
Soaring rents and low interest rates on mortgages have meant that the difference in cost between buying and renting a home is now at a historic high.

Millions of young people – who pay as much as a third of their salary in rent – are desperately trying to escape so-called ‘Generation Rent’. Some even opt-out of saving into a workplace pension schemes and put that cash towards a deposit.

However, in doing so they risk missing out on valuable tax breaks and contributions from employers designed to provide security in retirement.

The trade-off for those without any help from the Bank of Mum and Dad is tough. Do they scrimp on pension savings and buy a home? Or save into a pension, never end up...
description: Soaring rents and low interest rates on mortgages have meant that the difference in cost between buying and renting a home is now at a historic high.
